category: Member City/Provincial Sports Association Regulations/Article 25 (Neutrality of Elections)
contents: Article 25 (Neutrality of elections) ① Deleted 2021. 10. 6. ② Deleted 2021. 10. 6. ③ Executives and employees of the city/provincial sports council are responsible for the election of the president of the sports council, member organizations of the sports council, member organizations of the city/provincial sports council, and You must not exercise undue influence or engage in any other act that affects the election results in connection with the elections of sports organizations, such as member organizations, and you must not exercise undue influence or engage in any other act that affects the election results, and you must not exercise any influence on sports organizations, such as member organizations of the Sports Association, member organizations of city/provincial sports associations, and their member organizations. You must not request other executives, employees, representatives, voters, etc. to perform such acts, or promise benefits or disadvantages as compensation or retaliation for doing so. Revised 2019. 9. 2., 2022. 5. 10. ④ If an officer or employee of a city/provincial sports council violates paragraph 3, registered directors (in the case of other sports organizations, they shall be registered directors of the relevant organization) 3/3 1. Disciplinary action against the person involved may be requested with the consent of 1/4 of the delegates (in the case of other sports organizations, it shall be the registered delegates of the relevant organization). In this case, the city/provincial sports council must discipline the person involved unless there are special reasons. ⑤ In order to ensure the fairness of city/provincial sports association elections, the Sports Council may order improvements in the management of city/provincial sports council president elections, etc., and in this case, the city/provincial sports council must follow this. Revised 2022. 5. 10.
